verb.description: Withstand the action or effect of.
examples: antibodies help us to resist infection

noun.description: A resistant substance applied as a coating to protect a surface during some process, for example to prevent dye or glaze adhering.

origin: Late Middle English: from Old French resister or Latin resistere, from re- (expressing opposition) + sistere stop (reduplication of stare to stand). The current sense of the noun dates from the mid 19th century.
